title: Authors and Citation
text: Matthew B. Jané. Author, maintainer. Luke C. Pilling. Author. Christopher T. Kenny. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Jané M, Pilling L, Kenny C (2023). ThemePark: Themes ggplot2 Popular Culture. R package, https://github.com/MatthewBJane/ThemePark.
code: @Manual{ThemePark,   title = {{ThemePark}: Themes for ggplot2 from Popular Culture},   author = {Matthew B. Jané and Luke C. Pilling and Christopher T. Kenny},   year = {2023},   note = {R package},   url = {https://github.com/MatthewBJane/ThemePark}, }

title: Themes for ggplot2 from Popular Culture
text: Theme Park package fun ggplot themes related popular culture (movies, TV shows, video-games, etc.). don’t much time expand please consider submitting theme!

title: Themes for ggplot2 from Popular Culture
text: Please help grow package submitting custom ggplot theme movie, show, videogame. submit, edit theme_template.R script file run ThemePark:::new_theme_park_theme() send edited script matthew.jane@uconn.edu submit pull request. review add respond suggested edits. fun !

title: Themes for ggplot2 from Popular Culture
text: can install development version ThemePark GitHub :
code: # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("MatthewBJane/ThemePark")

title: Themes for ggplot2 from Popular Culture
text: many theme options, listed . can see list within R session using: Barbie theme (theme_barbie()) one popular themes ThemePark. Use included dataset barbie_box_office like :  example using Game Thrones theme.  can mix colors Barbie theme.
code: library(ThemePark) head(themepark_themes) #>         theme                     creator #> 1      barbie             Matthew B. Jané #> 2 oppenheimer Matthew B. Jané & Toki Liam #> 3    starwars             Matthew B. Jané #> 4       zelda               Alex Slavenko #> 5  terminator               Alex Slavenko #> 6   spiderman           Velu P.K. Immonen library(ggplot2)  # see suggested colours in the palette barbie_theme_colors #>        text       panel      border     lighter       light      medium  #> "#a62675ff" "#fdf6faff" "#d74ea2ff" "#f5d1e6ff" "#eeb4d7ff" "#d74ea2ff"  #>        dark  #> "#bf2986ff"  # plot Box Office Takings (in million USD) over Days Since Release ggplot(barbie_box_office |> dplyr::mutate(daily=daily/1000000),         aes(x = day, y = daily)) +     geom_smooth(method = 'loess',                  color  = barbie_theme_colors["dark"],                 fill   = barbie_theme_colors["light"]) +     geom_point(color = barbie_theme_colors["medium"]) +     labs(title = "Barbie Scatter Plot",          subtitle = "Daily box office takings",          caption  = "Source: www.boxofficemojo.com",          x = "Days since release",          y = "Box office takings (million USD)") +     theme_barbie() #> `geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x' # see suggested colours in the palette gameofthrones_theme_colors #> background       text      panel     border    lighter      light     medium  #>  "#1f0700"  "#D7B257"  "#F2F3B8"  "#BD6D33"  "#F2F3B8"  "#DFCB69"  "#BD6D33"  #>       dark  #>  "#8C4522"  `X variable` <- rnorm(50, 0, 1) `Y variable` <- rnorm(50, 0, 1)  ggplot(data = NULL, aes(x = `X variable`, y = `Y variable`)) +   theme_gameofthrones(gameofthrones_font = TRUE) +   geom_smooth(method = "lm",               color = gameofthrones_theme_colors["dark"],               fill = gameofthrones_theme_colors["light"]) +   geom_point(color = gameofthrones_theme_colors["medium"]) +   ggtitle("Game of Thrones Scatter Plot") #> `geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x' g <- ggplot(mpg, aes(cty)) g + geom_density(fill = barbie_theme_colors["medium"]) +     labs(         title = "Density plot",         subtitle = "City Mileage",         caption = "Source: mpg",         x = "City Mileage"     ) +     theme_gameofthrones() ggplot(data = NULL, aes(x = `X variable`, y = `Y variable`)) +   theme_avatar(avatar_font = TRUE) +   geom_smooth(method = "lm", color = avatar_theme_colors["dark"], fill = avatar_theme_colors["light"]) +   geom_point(color = avatar_theme_colors["medium"]) +   ggtitle("Avatar Scatter Plot") #> `geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x' ggplot(data.frame(x = rnorm(100), y = rnorm(100)), aes(x, y)) +   geom_smooth(method = "lm", color = godfather_theme_colors["dark"], fill = godfather_theme_colors["light"]) +   geom_point(color = godfather_theme_colors["medium"]) +   labs(title = "The Godfather theme", x = "Variable x", y = "Variable y") +   theme_godfather(godfather_font = TRUE) #> `geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'

title: Themes for ggplot2 from Popular Culture
code: @software{JaneBarbie2023,   author = {Jané, Matthew B. and Pilling, Luke C. and Kenny, Christopher T.},   month = {6},   title = {ThemePark: popular culture ggplot themes},   url = {https://github.com/MatthewBJane/ThemePark},   version = {0.0.1},   year = {2023} }

title: Themes for ggplot2 from Popular Culture
text: Jané, M.B., Pilling, Luke C., & Kenny, Christopher T. (2023). ThemePark: popular culture ggplot themes (Version 0.0.9) [Source Code]. https://github.com/MatthewBJane/ThemePark

what: ThemePark: Themes for 'ggplot2' from Popular Culture — ThemePark-package
title: ThemePark: Themes for 'ggplot2' from Popular Culture — ThemePark-package
text: Provides 'ggplot2' themes mirror works popular culture, Barbie, Star Wars, Game Thrones, others. package currently holds 14 themes number corresponding discrete color scales, palettes, fonts. theme (e.g., 'theme_barbie') generates unique color scheme font 'ggplot2' object matches color scheme font found movie, TV show, video game.

title: ThemePark: Themes for 'ggplot2' from Popular Culture — ThemePark-package
text: Maintainer: Matthew B. Jané matthew.jane@uconn.edu Authors: Luke C. Pilling L.Pilling@exeter.ac.uk (ORCID) Christopher T. Kenny christopherkenny@fas.harvard.edu (ORCID)

title: Barbie Box Office Data — barbie_box_office
text: data contains box office data Barbie movie, first 50 days (July 21, 2023 September 8, 2023).

title: Barbie Box Office Data — barbie_box_office
code: data("barbie_box_office")

title: Barbie Box Office Data — barbie_box_office
text: tibble 50 rows 11 columns date date. Box office date. dow factor. Day week. rank integer. Box office rank. daily integer. Daily gross USD. percent_yd numeric. Gross change per day percent. percent_lw numeric. Gross change per week percent. theaters integer. Number theatres. avg_per_theater integer. Per theater average gross. to_date integer. Gross date. day integer. Day showing, indexed 1. estimated logical. Flag data estimated.

title: ALIEN Inspired Color Scales — scale_fill_alien
code: scale_fill_alien(...)  scale_color_alien(...)

title: ALIEN Inspired Color Scales — scale_fill_alien
code: library(ggplot2)  ggplot(mpg) +   geom_point(aes(y = class, x = hwy, color = cyl)) +   labs(title="MPG by Vehicle Type",        caption="Source: mpg",        x = "City Mileage",        color ="# Cylinders") +   theme_alien() +   scale_color_alien() +facet_grid(.~class)

title: Elf Inspired Color Scales — scale_color_elf_c
code: scale_color_elf_c(...)  scale_fill_elf_c(...)  scale_color_elf_b(...)  scale_fill_elf_b(...)  scale_color_elf_d(...)  scale_fill_elf_d(...)  scale_colour_elf_d(...)  scale_colour_elf_c(...)  scale_colour_elf_b(...)

title: Elf Inspired Color Scales — scale_color_elf_c
text: ... Additional arguments pass ggplot2::binned_scale _b, ggplot2::scale_[fill/color]_gradient _c, ggplot2::discrete_scale _d

title: Elf Inspired Color Scales — scale_color_elf_c
code: library(ggplot2)  ggplot(mpg, aes(cty)) + geom_density(aes(fill=factor(cyl)), alpha=0.8) +   labs(title="Density plot",        subtitle="City Mileage Grouped by Number of cylinders",        caption="Source: mpg",        x="City Mileage",        fill="# Cylinders") +   facet_wrap(~(hwy > 29)) +   theme_elf() +   scale_fill_elf_d()

text: alien_font theme_alien use Google Font's 'Roboto Condensed'? Default TRUE. ... additional parameters pass ggplot2::theme()

title: ALIEN Inspired Theme — theme_alien
code: library(ggplot2)  ggplot(data = data.frame(x = rnorm(50, 0, 1), y = rnorm(50,0,1)), aes(x = x, y = y)) +   geom_smooth(method = 'lm',              color = alien_theme_colors["dark"],              fill =  alien_theme_colors["light"]) +  geom_point(color =  alien_theme_colors["medium"]) +  labs(title = 'ALIEN Scatter Plot') +  theme_alien() #> `geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'   ggplot(mpg, aes(cty)) + geom_density(aes(fill=factor(cyl)), alpha=0.8) +   labs(title="Density plot",        subtitle="City Mileage Grouped by Number of cylinders",        caption="Source: mpg",        x="City Mileage",        fill="# Cylinders") +   theme_alien()
